name: Dairy UK
memberOrga: Principle members include Arla Foods, Muller Wiseman Dairies, Dairy Crest Dairies, First Milk, Lactalis, Glanbia, Volac and OMSCo plus 66 other medium sized and smaller dairy co-ops and processors.
goal:
Dairy UK is the trade association for the UK dairy supply chain. It brings together farmers, dairy co-operatives and manufacturers, bottle milk buyers and milkmen throughout the United Kingdom.

Dairy UK’s mission is to create an environment:

• in which dairy foods are seen as safe, sustainable and integral to the nation’s diet;
• that allows the dairy sector to compete and grow without an undue burden of regulation.

Issues focused on by Dairy UK include:

• Public health and nutrition,
• Dairy policy matters, such as the implementation of the Common Agriculture Policy,
• Environment and sustainability, including the Climate Change Agreements,
• Scientific and technical issues in the supply chain, including animal health and composition standards of dairy products.

Dairy UK activities include:

• defending and promoting the industry to the media,
• educating and informing stakeholders about the UK dairy industry,
• providing a platform for discussion of issues of importance to the industry,
• providing a vehicle for the provision of pre-competitive services to the sector,
• undertaking a crisis management function when necessary,
• representing the interests of the industry to government, the EU and other relevant institutions
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health, Trade
euInitiatives:
Dairy UK will follow any EU file relevant to our remit and objectives above but the files currently being pursued include:
- Review of the Best Available Techniques Reference Documents
- EFSA Review of Chlorate residues in food
- EU Circular Economy Package
- National Emissions Ceiling Directive
- Country of Origin Labelling
- CAP 2020
